item.title: A Story of Statistical Writing and Life Expectancy
item.description: The Statistical Excellence Award for Early-Career Writing is an annual competition run by Significance and the RSS Young Statisticians Section. Entrants are asked to use data and statistics to tell the stories that matter most to them. Today we (@signmagazine and @statsyss) are pleased to announce the finalists of the 2021 Statistical Excellence Award for Early-Career Writing, with stories about luck, life expectancy, and a weather-predicting tortoise https://t.co/NbwatlYiGM pic.twitter.com/VlAsmaR6uq — Significance (@signmagazine) July 8, 2021 Congratulations to all competition entrants, especially winner Connor Jackson, and fellow finalist Anna Beukenhorst.
